website_summaries.verdict: Worth a look if you need tweezers that are suited for precision plucking, but we recommend traditional options for everyday tweezing.
pros: Ideal for grabbing tiny hairs, as the stainless steel, finely pointed tips are designed for tasks that require precision
Ideal for removing ticks, splinters, and ingrown hairs
cons: Extra care must be taken when using them, as the tips are quite sharp
May not work on some coarse hairs

customer_reviews.title: BEST tweezers ever
customer_reviews.text: I'm a tweezerman diehard and I've owned many pairs, but none are as sharp or gentle as the ingrown hair tweezers. I love these. Hold them parallel to your skin rather than pointing towards it to avoid poking yourself!
customer_reviews.author: k.bar

customer_reviews.title: grip is substandard don't buy.
customer_reviews.text: they are what I needed but problem is they don't grip very well at all I purchased a Blade brand from cvs and were way better half the price. Im thinking these are knock offs or a I just got a bad pair idk .
customer_reviews.author: Arland kerkove

customer_reviews.title: Tweezerman ingrown hair splintertweeze
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair that I bough. The first pair I sent back to readjust the alignment to no avail after having had to insure package. They were wonderful for many years. So I bought a second pair and they do not grip the hair on my chin, not aligned correctly. So I bought a third pair and the same thing is happening. I am currently using my original pair and just bend them from time to time. They just don't seem to be aligned correctly. I am stumped as what to do?
customer_reviews.author: Deanna Lavergne

customer_reviews.title: I am a carpenter who uses this for splinters. ...
customer_reviews.text: I am a carpenter who uses this for splinters. The tip is sharp enough that I don't need a needle to open up the hole to find the splinter. Sharp enough to act as a needle only if you want. Expect it to last a lifetime, so it is worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: David Satterlund

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for eyebrows
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Tweezerman. pair of tweezers, this pair is excellent! Although it is advertised for splinters, which works well for that also, it’s excellent for eyebrows and any small object you would like to remove from your skin. It’s a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: Misc

customer_reviews.title: These work beautifully for that and ingrown hair as
customer_reviews.text: I use these for hair splinters im a barber and anyone in the profession knows the annoyance of hair splinters. These work beautifully for that and ingrown hair as well
customer_reviews.author: Day-o

customer_reviews.title: Toughness
customer_reviews.text: I am kinda disappointed. I use to sell Tweezerman. It is a terrific brand. This pair, unfortunately, is not what I expected. I expected a little more sturdiness. It does gets the job done, I will give them that.
customer_reviews.author: MARIA S.

customer_reviews.title: Unimpressed.
customer_reviews.text: Not the quality I’m used to with tweezerman. I own at least a dozen of their products which I love. These are not as sharp or precise, maybe bent a little or uneven making it hard to use the very tip to tweeze with.
customer_reviews.author: RL Herring

customer_reviews.title: Not the same
customer_reviews.text: I should have taken the warning o other reviews. These are not sharp and they don't grab well at all. I have been using this brand for many years and I think it's time to switch.
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: Sharp and get the job done.
customer_reviews.text: These are very sharp and get the job done. I constantly have ingrown hairs on my neck. It is exhausting... I keep a shot glass full of hydrogen peroxide on my bathroom counter and put these in it after each use as a disinfectant of some sort. Tweezerman is no joke. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Mister Freeze

customer_reviews.title: Waste
customer_reviews.text: Not even close to as good as my other tweezer man point tweezers, I have a mini set and use them for ingrown hairs, this just broke them. It sucks. Don’t buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Ajamz

customer_reviews.title: A must have tool
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how I ever lived without one of these. I had a sliver and tried every tweezer in the house. Then I tried a needle with no luck. I waited the two days to get this and within seconds after unboxing, my sliver just came right out. Magic! This thing is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: pickyshopper

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I had another pair of tweezer man tweezers the were extra pointed and sharp. They were great. These are not as sharp or good.
customer_reviews.author: cookiecat

customer_reviews.title: Not the same tweezerman quality
customer_reviews.text: Such a shame... not the same quality product expected from tweezerman. I returned my first order and replaced it with a second, hoping I had just received a bad pair. Unfortunately both pairs were dull, misaligned, and did not grab the hair well. I have ordered a different brand for the first time in 10 years hoping for better results.
customer_reviews.author: Alexa

customer_reviews.title: love 'em!
customer_reviews.text: Really great - nicely ground to fit together tightly to firmly grab what you want. They're so sharp, they pushed through the protective cap, though.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron R

customer_reviews.title: More like pointy regular tweezers
customer_reviews.text: Love Tweezerman but these aren’t fine enough for intended purpose. They are probably as sharp as their product liability attorneys will let them be made but it doesn’t cut it.
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME TWEEZERS
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THESE BEST TWEEZERS ON THE MARKET GET KITLE TINY HAIRS THA NO OTHER TWEEZER CAN GET AND SPLINTERS TO THEY ARE AWESOME AND I LOVE THEY COME IN A LITTLE POUCH I HAVE 2 PAIR DO NOT WANT TO BE WITH OUT THEM
customer_reviews.author: TERRY WOLF

customer_reviews.title: Too soft for hair.
customer_reviews.text: These are very soft and flimsy. They dont work on hair much less ingrown hair.
customer_reviews.author: Neecy

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tweezer for splinters and ingrown hairs.
customer_reviews.author: Bellyjel

customer_reviews.title: Love These!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic price, product, and great foe removing annoying hair splinters.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Inferior product
customer_reviews.text: NOT precise and inferior product to what Tweezerman used to manufacture
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Essential First Aid And Bathroom Tool
customer_reviews.text: Great for removing ingrown hairs. The gauge of metal used on these tweezers is not too thin, and I find the product to be of high quality. Be careful with these tweezers, ad they are very sharp. I would buy this product again, even though it is a little pricey.
customer_reviews.author: John T. Obrien

customer_reviews.title: I use it too much because it's the best product
customer_reviews.text: I use this for acne. I really love this product. I use it too much, and eventually wear out the tips. It's the best product I have found for the purpose.
customer_reviews.author: barbara a barrington

customer_reviews.title: Very accurate
customer_reviews.text: Accurate point/closing, however the edges of the tips are sharp enough to cut hairs if you pull at an angle.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your time
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my eyebrows which are very fine. The tip will not grip .
customer_reviews.author: Brina

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Twizzers for Hard to reach place
customer_reviews.text: I like the fine point to get exactly. The long twizzer to get into small places
customer_reviews.author: deb

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but they do the job well!
customer_reviews.text: These are the only brand tweezer that actually work at tweezing fine hairs. They are awesome. The only drawback is that one drop will alter them so they could have been made a bit stronger. But the company stands by their sharpening guarantee.. so please buy maybe if more people buy they’ll come down to a normal price.
customer_reviews.author: Rickyi Wade

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Very good to remove ingrown hairs or for precision plucking
customer_reviews.author: Bina

customer_reviews.title: Ingrown hairs remain under skin
customer_reviews.text: Nicely aligned ,feels good in your hand. Will pull out any hair that has emerged and above skin surface. For ingrown hairs, the tips are not sharp enough to remove hair below skin where ingrown hairs lay. Still need a sharper tool, like a pin to dig it out. It's an awful thing to take a pin to your skin, but the ingrown`s are tough to remove. Still searching for the SHARP POINTED tweezers.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer D

customer_reviews.title: Sharp
customer_reviews.text: Very sharp. Knowing where the point is takes getting used to but that's because I'm used to wedge eye brow tweezers. Would buy again but I think these will last a lifetime. They come in a bulky reusable case and with a tip protector. Save the tip guard or you'll hurt yourself and maybe dull the tip.
customer_reviews.author: Delayed Gratification

customer_reviews.title: These are not like the pointed tweezerman
customer_reviews.text: They just break off the hairs. I wish I had gotten a different pair.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael Sawyer

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased!
customer_reviews.text: Work just like they should, fast shipping, I'm very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: JFN

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for ingrown hairs
customer_reviews.text: I wish this came a day sooner to help get an ingrown out but when it did arrive i was able to pluck the ingrown easily. Much better than typical tweezers. I get a lot of ingrowns so i needed a tweezers that would get those fine hairs that i could see but couldnt pluck with other tweezers. These do the job great. Be very careful because they have a very fine point. I did notice they sell these at Bed Bath Beyond(use your 20% coupon).
customer_reviews.author: Steve D

customer_reviews.title: Ingrown beard hairs now fear me...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for ingrown facial hair. Best ive found. Half the price of the salon.
customer_reviews.author: Chantel La´ree

customer_reviews.title: Sharp!
customer_reviews.text: Where have these been all my life? Every adult should own a pair.
customer_reviews.author: Atlanna

customer_reviews.title: Not as great as expected
customer_reviews.text: I have always bought Tweezerman products but this one didn't work as well as I expected. No sure if it the tips or the hold.
customer_reviews.author: Al of Fl

customer_reviews.title: The only tweezers I will buy...
customer_reviews.text: These are great, and are the only tweezers I will buy now. I have 3 pair to keep in different places.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: This was my third pair of ingrown hair tweezers, and it pales in comparison to others I've tried. The ends don't touch perfectly, making it difficult to grap the hair without causing damage to the skin around it. You're better off with the Tweezerman GEAR ingrown tweezers.
customer_reviews.author: abcphd

customer_reviews.title: As advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I think I could perform surgery with these. They're that good.
customer_reviews.author: Tech

customer_reviews.title: Top Quality, but for Other Uses
customer_reviews.text: This tool is of the highest quality, and I think we even used these exact tweezers in a laboratory I worked in for dealing with very small fibers. I can't really imagine better-made pointy tweezers. Shaving gives me ingrown hairs, though, and I can't say these tweezers have ever helped. Perhaps I don't know how to use them properly, and they're really handy for other uses, but not really good for my ingrown hairs.
customer_reviews.author: AveryCloseCall

customer_reviews.title: They do it.
customer_reviews.text: Well made and help with my ingrown hairs well. Easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer cala

customer_reviews.title: USELESS!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Tweezerman poducts for YEARS! I just can't believe this is a genuine Tweezerman tweezer. It's as dull as dull can be and tips don't seem to line up correctly, as it can't pluck anything. USELESS! I wouldn't even give it one star.
customer_reviews.author: raku

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: The tweezers are not alligned. They don't work at all, can't grab anything.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan Savercool

customer_reviews.title: Do not Work
customer_reviews.text: I have used this brand and style for years and this one was defective. I took an old/new side-by-side photo and it's bent. Does not tweeze. You cannot return them.
customer_reviews.author: LaLa

customer_reviews.title: They work Fantastic! Have great grip and a fairly fine point
customer_reviews.text: These tweezers don't have the finest point available but they do have really excellent gripping power. Much better than any other tweezers I've used like this. The contact area at the point (this is important) is also really excellent so it's easier to grab very fine hairs.
customer_reviews.author: R-Cad

customer_reviews.title: Precision Instruments
customer_reviews.text: My wife being a Cosmetologist, I never thought a person could actually get human hair embedded in their hands, feat or other areas. Hair trimmings can be like little needles. This pair of really sharp tweezers really do the trick grabbing onto those little hairs that penetrate the skin. Theses with a strong
customer_reviews.author: Big-D

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: After buying multiple pairs of more expensive tweezers, this is the absolute best. I will be ordering several more backup pairs. The tip is a true needlepoint unlike many other similar products. These are great for digging out very fine ingrown hairs without tearing up the skin.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah G.

customer_reviews.title: Easyyyy
customer_reviews.text: This is my preferred brand of tweezers. It's a great tool to pull out all of the tiny gunk in my face. It is sharp and requires a deal of stability or it could quite... Painful. Easy to hold and easy to pinch. Overall great product.
customer_reviews.author: OHREOH

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: This is just not the same quality as tweezerman. I’d go to the official website to buy this.
customer_reviews.author: AMANDA

customer_reviews.title: *not* a needle point!
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't grasp a ingrown hair at all I have to dig out the ingrown hair with a needle then I can grab the hair with this product. if you are wanting something that can dig the ingrown hair out this wouldn't be the right product for you, the so called point isn't really a point it's squared off and just doesn't grasp the small hair.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: The second set of tweezers you should have available!
customer_reviews.text: I happened to run across these tweezers when looking for something else online. I quickly realized these would meet a purpose at home - besides ingrown hairs, they're excellent for pulling splinters and, a problem for me, nails that splinter on my hands and feet. Besides a regular pair of blunt edge tweezers, every home should have a pair of these around for those problems that the blunt edge tweezers just can't handle. The tips are just as sharp as they look so you do want to keep the little rubber tube over them when not in use to avoid accidental sticks. Well made, these are worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: John Bales

customer_reviews.title: These are perfect for taking out slivers
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for taking out slivers! It makes taking slivers out of kids' feet 100% easier, the grip is good, the pinch and precision is militaristic. Good quality and overall very satisfied with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Johnson's

customer_reviews.title: Trust In Tweezerman
customer_reviews.text: Excellent brand. Love these tweezers! May be expensive yet they are worth it
customer_reviews.author: HopeLove

customer_reviews.title: Good for splinters
customer_reviews.text: Tweezerman makes amazing tweezers...I bought a bunch of them to have in my travel bag and around the house, different sizes and kinds. This one is for splinters. A must have if you work with wood.
customer_reviews.author: JCK

customer_reviews.title: Great, better than the one I broke
customer_reviews.text: Great, better than the one I broke. Handle is heavier or should I say wider. Makes for better grip. You will love this one.
customer_reviews.author: brisinger

customer_reviews.title: Very good just need to be careful it's very sharp
customer_reviews.text: Very good just need to be careful it's very sharp
customer_reviews.author: fatima thomson

customer_reviews.title: Great for woodworkers
customer_reviews.text: Great for woodworkers, just had a deep splinter & tweezers have a small sharp point that took out immediately. Where were these all my life. Every wood shop should have a pair .good buy for the price.Larry
customer_reviews.author: Larry A.

customer_reviews.title: Not A Happy Customer.
customer_reviews.text: Does not work at all.. What happened to you Tweezerman?
customer_reviews.author: Saam Dalal

customer_reviews.title: Very very fine point on these and they have a wider grip ...
customer_reviews.text: If it's not a tweezerman, you shouldn't be buying it. Very very fine point on these and they have a wider grip to them. They fit nicely in your fingers and squeeze with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: The quality is not as sturdy as before. It feels flimsy...
customer_reviews.author: mAdCoOk

customer_reviews.title: Great for splinters
customer_reviews.text: I used them to remove a splinter that was left for about a day. They were capable of digging through the dead skin and removing the soggy wooden splinter.
customer_reviews.author: Daryl John meier

customer_reviews.title: Dont leave town without them
customer_reviews.text: The very sharp points at as needles so you can did out stubborn splinters with one tool. They are great!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hatfield

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my toiletry bag as you never know when you might get a sliver on vacation.
customer_reviews.author: MuddyPuppy

customer_reviews.title: Not precision as suggested by other reviews
customer_reviews.text: Points don't really line up very well so it is very difficult to grab a splinter. I was expecting more precision based on other reviews. The two times so far I needed to use I couldn't get it to grip.
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: Good, but the Mini Slant/Point Set is Better
customer_reviews.text: Got these to add versatility to my Tweezerman Mini Slant/Point set. Although they are top-notch quality, I really only needed the set. These offer no advantage as far as I can tell.
customer_reviews.author: Wingin' it

customer_reviews.title: Tweezerman is the best tweezers I’ve ever used!
customer_reviews.text: I liked the ease and accuracy of this product. I use it to remove facial hair.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay L. Wells

customer_reviews.title: I remain unimpressed with these tweezers. They are no ...
customer_reviews.text: I remain unimpressed with these tweezers. They are no sharper than others I have, hence, the price you pay is not justified. I got a complete set of sharps from eBay for only $5 which are a match in quality and sharpness.
customer_reviews.author: Chet

customer_reviews.title: This thing works great!
customer_reviews.text: I get a lot of splinters. This thing works great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy and ineffective
customer_reviews.text: Does not work well! It just doesn’t grip the hair well. Feels really lightweight and flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Ann5306

customer_reviews.title: These are perfect for ingrown hair and splinters
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for ingrown hair and splinters! I bought a set for my bathroom and second for my first aid kit!
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Remove Cactus Needles
customer_reviews.text: Excellent not only for ingrown hairs but also for removing cactus needles which is why I bought this. Never hike in cactus country without tweezers just like this!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Chin hair is no match!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect tweezer! Do not drop on the floor. Great company and will fix for free!
customer_reviews.author: annmarie p.

customer_reviews.title: Quality not what I'm used to from Tweezerman.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't grip fine hairs or even course ones for that matter. The tips are NOT precision. Trying to get them replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Karen E

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for removing splinters in the wood shop. Important part of the first aid kit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tweezerman's are spectacular
customer_reviews.text: Tweezerman tweezers are amazing!! If you take proper care of them they'll last a long time
customer_reviews.author: Amy Pierce

customer_reviews.title: These tweezers are great! They are excellent for precision detail work like ...
customer_reviews.text: These tweezers are great! They are excellent for precision detail work like getting out ingrown hairs and splinters. The wide finger base is great for grip. These are my second pair of Tweezerman Tweezers and I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: chrisives

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: These are sturdy and precise tweezers. I don't use them as described but they serve well to hold small parts for gluing and similar activities.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Ok wish they were sharper and a bit more precise
customer_reviews.author: michelle d

customer_reviews.title: I love these so much
customer_reviews.text: I love these so much. n=best pair of tweezers I have ever owned. ingrown hairs are a huge problem for me and these tweezers are the only thing that helps.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Great for ticks
customer_reviews.text: Great for ticks, high quality brand that is very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: The best!
customer_reviews.text: These work excellent for those pesky ingrown hairs. They are really sharp. Love these and will buy nothing but tweezerman tweezer products.
customer_reviews.author: L in Florida

customer_reviews.title: Not sharp
customer_reviews.text: The tip was not as sharp as they used to make it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best tweezers ever!
customer_reviews.text: Great for removing splinters! I can't do without this product!
customer_reviews.author: C.R. Bounds

customer_reviews.title: I understand each pair of tweezers are unique. This ...
customer_reviews.text: I understand each pair of tweezers are unique. This pair was a bit disappointing. Too thick at the tips.
customer_reviews.author: Annette Konieczka

customer_reviews.title: Helpful but not adequate for serious ingrown facial hair.
customer_reviews.text: Item okay, but not adequate for removing ingrown chin or upper lip hair. The handles cannot provide the control to remove the hair.
customer_reviews.author: Madge

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed for getting ingrown hairs. Will probably last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Handy tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a very handy tool to have. I've removed ingrown hairs and splinters. Had to order a new one because I lost my first one.
customer_reviews.author: DI

customer_reviews.title: These suck
customer_reviews.text: THEY DO NOT WORK AND I CANNOT RETURN.. THANKS, GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No longer cut nails
customer_reviews.text: Product failed in under a year. Blades are not aligned and cannot cut.
customer_reviews.author: Paul D. Teini

customer_reviews.title: Fragile as hell, don't drop it in the sink
customer_reviews.text: I loved this until just after my one month Amazon return period I dropped it in my sink and the tip bent, ruining the grip. I didn't do heavy construction with this thing, I simply dropped it in the sink, about 1.5 foot drop, something everyone with tweezers accidentally does at some point. The tip bent, it was unusable, I bent it back and now it's so-so. Great tool otherwise but it would have been nice to warn people that this is easily damaged. I'd still consider buying a new one for the price, but still, the fragility is disturbing.
customer_reviews.author: HalfGeek

customer_reviews.title: the ends bend very easily. Stainless
customer_reviews.text: You gotta take care of it , the ends bend very easily. Stainless, but the ends are not sturdy as the rest o fit
customer_reviews.author: Vishal D. Sachdev

customer_reviews.title: Sharpest tweezers I've ever seen
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing too small to grab with these. And they are not just sharp, but the sides come together perfectly flush, making it easy to pick things with the barest of material available.
customer_reviews.author: gregday

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Takes some getting used to but once you do, you’ll never want to go back
customer_reviews.author: Bao

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very fine, but almost too fine. Haven't used them much yet.
customer_reviews.author: kwilke

customer_reviews.title: FINALLY!
customer_reviews.text: I get very bad ingrown hairs in my pubic area from waxing, and this is the best (by far) tweezer I have come across to help me get them out.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Great tweezers
customer_reviews.text: Great tweezers and very sharp when first purchased but they dull very quickly...great for the price though !!!
customer_reviews.author: MCSIvy

customer_reviews.title: Great tweezers
customer_reviews.text: Great tweezers. Well made, tips are sharp and align perfectly, Just what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: LL

customer_reviews.title: The ultimate tweeze
customer_reviews.text: Best tweezers out there but it sometimes breaks the hair you are trying to tweeze, which is annoying. Be careful because the end, if not protected, gets bent and then does not work at all.
customer_reviews.author: Ari

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not as nice as when they were made in Italy, but they will serve.
customer_reviews.author: Boi Named Sous

customer_reviews.title: Much better than ordinary tweezers
customer_reviews.text: The day it arrived, I picked up a small splinter in my workshop. I'm 65 and have trouble seeing splinters even with reading glasses. I made a lucky guess as to where it was and these tweezers pulled it right out. I haven't seen it yet but it's gone. I'll be buying these as gifts to give out.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn White

product_meta.title: Tweezerman Ingrown Hair Splintertweeze
feature_bullets: Ingrown Hair/Splintertweeze has tapered tips that are hand-filed to sharp points
Makes removal of ingrown hairs and splinters as precise as possible
Stainless steel is durable and easy to clean
